SEARCH
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello

Class OthelloBoard

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello.OthelloBoard
public class OthelloBoard extends Object
Keep track of all of the tokens on the board. This understands some interesting things about an Othello board, what the board looks like at the start of the game, what the players tokens look like ('X' and 'O'), whether given coordinates are on the board, whether either of the players have a move somewhere on the board, what happens when a player makes a move at a specific location (the opposite players tokens are flipped). Othello makes use of the OthelloBoard.

  • Constructor Details

    • OthelloBoard

      public OthelloBoard(int dim)
      Constructor for OthelloBoard. Intializes the board with a width and height of dim. All positions are intially empty except for a 2x2 square in the center. The top left and bottom right of this square contains P1 and the top right and bottom left contains P2.
      Parameters:
      dim - the dimension of the board

  • Method Details

    • getDimension

      public int getDimension()
      Returns:
      the dimension of the board

    • otherPlayer

      public static char otherPlayer(char player)
      Parameters:
      player - either P1 or P2
      Returns:
      P2 or P1, the opposite of player

    • get

      public char get(int row, int col)
      Parameters:
      row - starting row, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      col - starting col, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      Returns:
      P1,P2 or EMPTY, EMPTY is returned for an invalid (row,col)

    • validCoordinate

      public boolean validCoordinate(int row, int col)
      Parameters:
      row - starting row, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      col - starting col, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      Returns:
      whether (row,col) is a position on the board. Example: (6,12) is not a position on the board.

    • hasMove

      public char hasMove()
      Returns:
      whether P1,P2 or BOTH have a move somewhere on the board, EMPTY if neither do.

    • move

      public boolean move(int row, int col, char player)
      Make a move for player at position (row,col) according to Othello rules, making appropriate modifications to the board. Nothing is changed if this is not a valid move.
      Parameters:
      row - starting row, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      col - starting col, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      player - P1 or P2
      Returns:
      true if player moved successfully at (row,col), false otherwise

    • getCount

      public int getCount(char player)
      Parameters:
      player - P1 or P2
      Returns:
      the number of tokens on the board for player

    • nonMutatedFlip

      public int nonMutatedFlip(int row, int col, int drow, int dcol, char player)
      Simulate a flip from all other player tokens to player, starting at (row,col) in direction (drow, dcol). Example: If (drow,dcol)=(0,1) and player==O then XXXO will result in a flip to OOOO. This does not mutate the board.
      Parameters:
      row - starting row, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      col - starting col, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
      drow - the row direction, in {-1,0,1}
      dcol - the col direction, in {-1,0,1}
      player - Either OthelloBoard.P1 or OthelloBoard.P2, the target token to flip to.
      Returns:
      the number of other player tokens gained, -1 if this is not a valid move in this one direction, that is, EMPTY or the end of the board is reached before seeing a player token.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this, just the play area, with no additional information. DO NOT MODIFY THIS!!
